writingApproach.style: Conversational; use analogies and real-world examples
writingApproach.complexity: Simple sentences; define all jargon; avoid acronyms or explain them immediately
writingApproach.structure: Start with why it matters; build concepts step-by-step
writingApproach.wordChoice: Everyday language; assume no prior knowledge

do: Use everyday analogies: Think of heating PVC like softening butter - just enough warmth makes it flexible
Connect to familiar products: The same PVC in your garden hose, plumbing pipes, or electrical conduit
Provide simple visual descriptions of what success looks like at each step
Use second person (you) to create connection
Explain the why behind each instruction
dont: Assume knowledge of chemistry or polymer science
Overwhelm with technical details about PVC composition
Skip foundational concepts like why PVC becomes flexible when heated

research.coreThesis: Bending PVC pipe at home is safe and achievable with the right temperature (210-275F), proper kink prevention (sand or spring), and understanding that bent pipes are for non-pressure applications only.

Sand method for kink prevention - proven technique

Pipes larger than 2 inch - limited DIY guidance, recommend fittings
Long-term durability claims - no hard data

Boiling water: Heat gun or heated sand methods produce more reliable results
